bioghist.p: Swarthmore College was founded in 1864 as a co-educational liberal arts institution by members of the Religious Society of Friends (Quakers).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of miscellaneous reports, studies, and self-assessments undertaken by Swarthmore College. Topics include: recruitment and retention of minority students; statistical information on admissions and alumni; the President's Ad Hoc Advisory Committee on Ethical Investment Principles; a 1958 Middle States Association of Colleges assessment of Swarthmore; a report from the Commission for Independent Colleges and Universities; and departmental assessments.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
